title: Digital Customer Support & AI Chatbots

sections.title: Modern Support Vocabulary
sections.content:
Fintech companies use technology to solve customer issues efficiently. Instead of waiting on hold, customers use digital channels.

- **AI Chatbot**: A computer program designed to simulate conversation with human users, especially over the Internet.
- **Support Ticket**: A record of a customer's request or problem that is tracked until it is resolved.
- **Escalation**: The process of moving a customer's issue to a higher level of support or a human agent.
- **Live Chat**: A service that allows customers to communicate with a support agent in real-time via the app or website.
- **Help Center (FAQ)**: A self-service portal with articles that answer common questions.
- **Resolution Time**: The total time it takes to solve a customer's problem.
- **Refund**: A repayment of a sum of money, typically to a customer who is not satisfied with a service or who was overcharged.

sections.title: Digital Support Flow
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Customer Problem] --> B{AI Chatbot}
    B -- Solves issue --> C[Ticket Closed]
    B -- Cannot solve --> D[Escalation]
    D --> E[Human Agent]
    E --> F[Investigation]
    F --> G[Resolution & Refund]
    G --> C
```

sections.title: Adverbs of Frequency: Support Patterns
sections.content:
We use adverbs of frequency to describe how often certain events occur in the support process.

**Common Adverbs:**
- **Always (100%)**: *The app **always** sends a confirmation email.*
- **Usually (80%)**: *The chatbot **usually** handles simple password resets.*
- **Often (60%)**: *Customers **often** use the help center before calling.*
- **Sometimes (40%)**: *Support tickets **sometimes** take 24 hours to resolve.*
- **Rarely (10%)**: *Human agents **rarely** intervene in basic balance inquiries.*
- **Never (0%)**: *We **never** share your security codes with support agents.*

**Word Order:**
- Before the main verb: *I **always** check the status of my ticket.*
- After the verb 'to be': *Technical issues are **rarely** permanent.*
